headline: This Recession Trade Is Happening in Property Stocks: Heard on the Street
summary: Property investors think American consumers will prioritize paying the rent and their cell-phone bills in a trade war.  Shares of the most economically sensitive property companies are cratering, especially those that are heavily exposed to discretionary spending.  Prologis, America’s biggest e-commerce warehouse REIT, is down 14% since President Trump unveiled his reciprocal tariffs.
